title: Unfinished Auction
content:
Unfinished Auction - unfinished business. This term is used to describe a situation where the extreme price level (upper, lower, or both) contains both buys and sells at the same time. The indicator is used to search and display similar situations in the market.
Important: if you are looking for a highlight at the low level, you need to have more bids at the low than the bid filter, and the number of asks should be greater than zero.
If you are looking for a highlight at the high level, you need to have more asks at the high than the ask filter, and the number of bids should be greater than zero.

To add and set up the indicator, open the Indicators settings window.


Indicator's settings

Settings

NameDescription
Bid Filter Bid volumes that are less than the value set in this filter will be ignored.
Ask Filter Ask volumes that are less than the value set in this filter will be ignored.

Calculation

NameDescription
Days look back Refers to the number of previous days taken into account when calculating an indicator.

Visualization

NameDescription
Line width Determines the width of the displayed line.
Low Line Color Determines the color of the displayed line.
High Line Color Determines the color of the displayed line.
Low Color This setting lets users choose the color for highlighting the price selections within clusters, providing a visual distinction from other elements on the chart.
High Color This setting lets users choose the color for highlighting the price selections within clusters, providing a visual distinction from other elements on the chart.

Alerts

NameDescription
Use alerts Enables or disables the sound notification.
Alert File This parameter allows users to specify the name of a custom audio file for alert sounds. Users can select a WAV file that will be played whenever an alert condition is triggered. The chosen WAV file should be located in the folder C:\Program Files (x86)\ATAS Platform\Sounds.
